body:
When the chart directory contains obvious temp or dev/test files such as the helm binary itself or binary files that are obviously larger than the allowed depl config map. helm starts deploying without a warning and then crashes deployment with the error failed to create: ConfigMap "SOME_NAME.v1" is invalid: []: Too long: must have at most 1048576 characters
this warning is not printed by the helm cli but just in the tiller logs wich makes it even harder to find.

expected behaviour: helm ignores files that are obviously senseless to it by standard. 

or: helm warns "There are large files in the chart directory, that would be bundled into your deployment. Should we add them to the .helmignore file? Y/n"

Output of `helm version`:
v2.9.1
